arch:property.oc:show_val: mudbrick wall running east-west at south edge of mudbrick wall 2126. The south edge of 2132 "peters out" with no clear cut line, but the brick material continues southwards. This entire wall system (2131, 2132, 2129, 2126, 2125) is founded on a cobblestone footing (2139); 12 courses of L2132 are preserved above the foundation stones.
part of one massive walll structure that includes loci 2131, 2132, 2129, 2126, 2125 and lowest elevations of 2114
silt loam with tiny pebbles in yellowish bricks but not in the reddish bricks
hard packed mudbrick of alternating color and composition (red bricks are hard, yellowish bricks are crumbly)

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: 2139 (dark brown mud filled in spaces between and on top of cobbles), 2126, 2129
one component of a massive mudbrick wall system 5+ feet thick running east-west across the trench

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area A / Trench 2 / Locus 2132 (Locus)
